page.title: 01Local History
page.content: Our area is historically very interesting.In our 3km x 4km Domesday block there is the site of a Roman road that runs straight through our area and passes by Blackmoor House.The Romans built their roads straight and this is a perfect example.In our area, two Roman coin hoards have been found,and also a Bronze age hoard.The Bronze age hoard was found in the Hogmoor Inclosure in about 1870.We have seventeen Tumuli which are ancient burial mounds. In Whitehill there is an old railway which was used in the Second World War,but is now not used.The Old School House was built in 1871 and is now called Blackmoor Village Hall. By Damien Sullivan Russell May
